alert.note: Alert for Colfax (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 12 at 4:48PM CDT until May 12 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL COLFAX AND EAST CENTRAL PLATTE COUNTIES... At 448 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 6 miles northeast of Lakeview, or 8 miles northeast of Columbus, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Colfax and east central Platte Counties, including the following locations... Shell Creek Elementary School, Central Community College, Lake North and Lake Babcock. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
